Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Annulment or divorce cases; when appearance has been made by counsel on behalf of defendant, notices to take depositions "may be served by delivering or mailing a copy to counsel for opposing party". Amending §§ 8-54 and 20-99

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Annulment or divorce; procedure following publication of notice and diligence by "adverse party to locate her or him or plaintiff without success". Amending § 8-76

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Cases tried or heard after publication; defendant who appears without counsel, notices may be given to him by regular United States mail. Amending § 8-73

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Civil proceedings; fees for certain court and justice of the peace services increased to three dollars "and twenty-five cents", increases fee for issuing officer. Amending § 14.1-125

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Claims against Commonwealth, partially or wholly disallowed by Comptroller or "other authorized person"; right of action deemed to accrue under provisions of "§§ 2.1-223.1 and 2.1-223.3". Amending § 8-752

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Compromise of claims for personal injury; infants, insane, feebleminded or incompetent persons. Amending § 8-170

Detail: Controversy, submission to by arbitration; procedure if either party refuses to cooperate in appointment of arbitrator(s). Amending § 8-503

Detail: Convicts as witnesses in courts of record; the "judge" shall issue "an order to Director of State Department of Welfare and Institutions to deliver such witness". Amending §§ 8-300 and 8-300.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Convicts previously sentenced to like punishment, additional confinement upon determination of evidence; procedure in Circuit Court of City of Richmond. Amending § 53-296

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Courts not of record; civil jurisdiction when amount of claim does not exceed three thousand dollars. Amending § 16.1-77

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Courts of record and courts not of record; authority to prescribe rules and regulations governing same. Adding § 8-1.3; repealing § 16.1-25

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Damages for injury arising out of defective or unsafe condition of improvements to real property; persons exempt from action to recover include those performing "surveying". Amending § 8-24.2.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Death by wrongful act, damages recoverable in action; maximum increased to "forty" thousand dollars, not applicable to action arising prior to "July one, nineteen hundred sixty-six". Amending § 8-636

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Death by wrongful act, distribution of damages; to include certain awards for "solace", funeral expenses, medical and hospital expenses and pecuniary loss. Amending § 8-636

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Decedents' estates, appraisement of; includes appointment of three or more competent appraisers, approval of "inventory" and appraisement by Commissioner of Accounts, prima facie evidence of value of estate "for all purposes". Amending § 64-126

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Declaratory judgments; commissioners to determine compensation for property taken or damaged. Adding § 8-581.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Divorce, affirmation and annulment of marriage; venue includes county or corporation in which plaintiff resides "in cases in which order of publication issued against defendant under § 8-71". Amending § 20-98

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Divorce, affirmation and annulment, service of process; provisions of § 8-47 regarding execution without county or city of venue shall not apply. Adding § 8-47.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Divorce suits; procedure when defendant in penitentiary has been legally served with a subpoena. Amending § 8-76

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Educational loans; minors sixteen years of age or older, liable for repayment if incurred by "reason of attendance at any school eligible for the guarantee of the State Education Assistance Authority". Amending § 8-135.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Emergency care; persons exempt from liability for civil damages who render emergency care or assistance at scene of accident, etc., without compensation. Amending § 54-276.9.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Estate of debtor, proceedings by interrogatories; affidavit required of execution creditor. Amending § 8-435

Detail: Estate of persons under disabilities; court may apply all or any portion to care for "the proper needs and requirements of the ward, or of the insane, incapacitated or ex-service person". Amending § 8-685

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Evidence, admissibility; includes "records maintained by electronic media or photographic process" in Division of Motor Vehicles, or "machine produced transcript or photograph" of records attested by Commissioner. Amending § 46.1-34.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Evidence, copies of records or papers which may be submitted in lieu of original; includes those in the offices of the "Central Criminal Records Exchange" and the Commissioner of Agriculture and "Commerce". Amending § 8-266

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Evidence; when plea of guilty in criminal prosecution admissible in civil action, proof of such plea

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Examinations, physical or mental; court may require same of a party prior to trial, written reports to be made. Adding § 8-210.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Fences; owners of land used for industrial or commercial purposes adjoining lands used for agricultural purposes shall be liable for building one-half of division fence. Amending § 8-887

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Funds belonging to infants or other incompetent persons; personal representative, guardian, etc., authorized to deposit certain funds with the general receiver of the court in which he was admitted to qualify. Adding § 8-744.01

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Garnishment proceedings, summons in; Chesapeake, Portsmouth and Norfolk justices of the peace may issue. Amending §§ 8-441 and 39-4.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Habeas corpus; if petition denied, costs and expenses to be assessed against petitioner and if collected, shall be paid to Commonwealth. Amending § 8-603

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Habeas corpus, writs of; petition filed by prisoner shall be provided and approved by Office of the Attorney General, contents of form. Adding § 8-596.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Habeas corpus, writs of; when petition may be granted and contents thereof. Amending § 8-596

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Highway Commission, State, members and officials testifying in civil proceedings involving official duties; deposition may be taken in main office of Commission following notice to adverse party, exception. Adding § 33-3.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Indemnifying bond to officer required to levy a warrant of distress, etc., to be equal "to double the value of the property in case of an attachment". Amending § 8-229

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Judgments by confession; provisions covering when judgment shall be a lien against the principal residence of the maker. Amending § 8-358

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Judicial sales, commissioners and officers selling property and collecting under decrees or orders for sale; commission allowed up to and including "twenty-five" thousand dollars. Amending § 8-669

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Jurors; compensation increased to "eight" dollars for each day of attendance upon the court. Amending § 8-204

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Jurors, determination of relationship, interest, bias or prejudice; "counsel for either party may ask any relevant question" pertaining thereto. Amending § 8-199

Detail: Jurors; persons exempt from jury service include servants of "mental hospitals", certain "housewives" and "persons who hold certificates to practice veterinary medicine or surgery", jury lists increased in certain counties. Amending §§ 8-178 and 8-182

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Jury commissioners; appointment by judges of circuit court of county or city or judge of city court. Amending § 8-180

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Jury lists, number of qualified persons; not to exceed six hundred in courts of Hampton City and Roanoke County. Amending § 8-182

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Jury service and jurors, minimum and maximum number to be selected in any county or city; exceptions include Norfolk, Virginia Beach, Charlottesville and Danville Cities and Henry, Chesterfield, Nansemond, Pulaski and Wythe Counties. Amending § 8-182

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Life expectancy, determination in certain cases in litigation; table used to establish same in all courts. Adding § 8-263.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Money under control of court when owner is unknown; procedure for disposition after five years. Amending § 8-746

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Motor vehicle violations; abstract of conviction in administrative hearing conducted by Division of Motor Vehicles, prima facie evidence of conviction. Adding § 46.1-436.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Partition of land; mineral rights east "and south of the Clinch River" included within provisions. Amending § 8-690

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Payments of certain small amounts of money accruing to infants, adults or incompetents without appointment of fiduciary; increases amount to "twenty-five" hundred dollars. Amending § 8-750

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Payments of small amounts to infants or certain incompetents without intervention of fiduciary; includes "intangible personal property" and increases amount to "twenty-five" hundred dollars. Amending § 8-751

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Personal service of process on nonresident defendant; presumption as to party being nonresident even though return fails to so state. Amending § 8-74

Detail: Proceeds of sale of real estate in case of death of certain incapacitated persons or infants; deletes "intestate" requirement. Amending § 8-689

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Removal of certain pending cases by courts or judges; provisions repealed. Repealing § 8-158

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Sale of lands of persons under disabilities; provisions for payment when proceeds not in excess of "two thousand five hundred dollars". Amending § 8-685

Detail: Service of process, Commissioner of Motor Vehicles as agent of nonresident motor vehicle operator; definition of nonresident includes "person against whom order of publication may be issued under provisions of § 8-71". Amending § 8-67.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Service of process, how made on Commissioner of Motor Vehicles as agent of nonresident motor vehicle operator; mailing shall be to the last known post office "address" of defendant. Amending § 8-67.2.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Service of process or notice; includes location of "registered" office of corporation. Amending § 8-65

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Subpoena duces tecum; may be issued by person appointed or acting under authority "in a judicial or quasi judicial capacity" upon notice to adverse party. Amending § 8-301

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Suits by assignee or beneficial owner in own name; "except as provided in § 8.9-206" shall allow all just documents, etc. Amending § 8-94

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY

Detail: Testimony concerning patients by practitioners of the healing arts; to include "a clinical psychologist duly licensed under the provisions of § 54-309.1". Amending § 8-289.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Testimony of witnesses; proceedings for perpetuation thereof. Amending § 8-317

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Timber cutting, damages for encroachment; owner shall have right of recovery in amounts specified in sections. Amending §§ 8-906, 8-908 and 8-909

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Trials; formal exceptions to rulings or orders of courts of record unnecessary, exception. Adding § 8-225.1.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Unlawful detainer of real property, when summons may be issued in certain cases; increases period of original lease to "two" years. Amending § 8-791

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Venue of actions and suits against any county or corporation; provisions include damages for personal injury or property damage. Amending § 8-38

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Wages lost in suits for personal injury; minor child may recover as part of his damages

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Water, sewer or sidewalk assessments; liens shall be brought within twenty years from due docketing of said assessment. Adding § 8-10.2.

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Weather records; admissible as evidence when copies duly attested by United States Weather Bureau and accompanied by certificate. Amending § 8-272

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Weather records used as evidence; to bear "the signature of an official of the United States Weather Bureau or the National Weather Records Center", to be accompanied by a certificate. Amending § 8-272

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Witnesses, deposition of nonresidents; procedure in any pending case, action or suit; repealing provision related to taking and preserving oral evidence in chancery causes. Amending § 8-305; repealing § 8-310

Subject: CIVIL REMEDIES AND PROCEDURE; EVIDENCE GENERALLY
Detail: Witnesses, trial, in courts of record and not of record; may be excluded from proceedings, exemption of certain individuals, officers or agents. Adding § 8-211.1.
